Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the rotation angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis with a depth of 0.75 units. 7. Perform a "New Body" boolean operation. Part 2 Instructions Shape: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0759, 0.6735, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle by drawing four lines: 1. Line 1: From (0.0, 0.0) to (0.5878, 0.0) 2. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.5878. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the rotation angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the negative Z-axis with a depth of 0.5878 units. 7. Perform a "Cut" boolean operation. Final shape: Connect the top surface of Part 1 with the top surface of Part 2 using a rectangular face. Perform a "Join" boolean operation to combine both parts.
